relatedanime.anime: Slam Dunk: Zenkoku Seiha Da! Sakuragi Hanamichi
Slam Dunk: Shouhoku Saidai no Kiki! Moero Sakuragi Hanamichi
Slam Dunk: Hoero Basketman-damashii! Hanamichi to Rukawa no Atsuki Natsu

recommendations.recommendation: Great show loved everything about it. But the ending was just meh. After all the great moments it leads up to what you really want to see and basically drops you off making you read the manga if you truly want closure. In all great anime for sports fans and anime fans alike. Just take the ending with a grain of salt lol.
Having read the manga the anime doesn`t rise to my expectation ,but it is a good sport anime overall but it`s mostly for basketball fans, and sport fans in general.
best sport anime i ever saw..
not a big fans of sport anime will enjoy this anime..coz of the comedy and some awesome scenes.
A must watch for sports anime!!

Highly recommended for fans of sport animes and i believe that in most cases if you are not one at the beginning then you will be at the end. Inspirational series with burning passion, manly tears and really cheesy sounding 90`s soundtrack that grows on you. Only thing that i didn`t like is that there was too much comedy in places they didn`t need to have it. Watched all the 101 episodes in one week.

There are anime that have not only become classic but legendary. Slam Dunk is an fine example of that. a fine jewel that withstands the test of time. even non sports fans if they give a chance to this show will end up loving it, as many of us have. Fine example of why anime became so popular, all around the world, during the 80`s and 90`s
A++++

If you are a fan of basketball and anime; this is a must watch. The manga will cover more than the anime; and probably will be easier to find. The art style is similar to GTO, realistic and full of expressions. A true classic that makes you wanna play basketball; whether you know how to play or not.

Been watching this since childhood, yet I still cant get tired of it. The jokes never get old I could watch it over and over and still laugh, masterpiece. The only downfall is that there isnt more... and probably never will be :`(

With Hajime no Ippo the best Sports Anime.

Must See for everyone, especially Basketball fans

anime.description: The hero of the piece is Sakuragi Hanamichi, a loud-mouthed, red-haired guy who has been rejected by girls 50 times in junior high. He meets the latest girl of his dreams, Akagi Haruko, and falls madly in love with her. He even goes so far as to join the basketball team to impress her, even though he knows nothing about the sport. But soon, he realizes that he truly loves basketball and he has talent for it. He`s bitter rivals with Rukawa Kaede, both on the court and out of it, because Haruko worships the ground Rukawa walks on, though he hardly notices she exists. The other main characters are Akagi Takenori, Haruko`s older brother who is also the captain of the team; Miyagi Ryota, who is in love with Ayako the team manager; and Mitsui Hisashi, a third-year former MVP (Most Valuable Player) who has been away from basketball for two years. Together, these unlikely misfits aim to transform Shohoku from a little-known team to the champion in all of Japan. Source: members.tripod.com/~Amis_Lee/summary.html

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: kitsune
tag.description: Kitsune is the Japanese word for http://anidb.net/t191 [fox], which are a common subject of Japanese folklore. This term in English specifically refers to kitsune as demon foxes or fox spirits. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t1814 [foxpersons], a http://anidb.net/t7 [juujin] with fox characteristics. Stories depict them as intelligent beings and as possessing magical abilities that increase with their age and wisdom. Foremost among these is the ability to assume human form.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: basketball
tag.description: Basketball is Netball for men, the real game that encourages dribbling and other such uncouth behaviour that was sanitised out of the ladies` version. However, it is itself woozy compared to Ulama, as the losing side are seldom publicly sacrificed.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: important haircut
tag.description: When a character cuts off his or her hair, it often symbolizes a rite of passage or bout of character growth. A princess striking out on an adventure, or a new recruit at boot camp, for instance. Hair is something that takes time and effort to grow, so parting with it voluntarily can be a powerful act. This is particularly a big deal when women get haircuts. Yet in fiction, even an accidental hair slicing can leave a character with a surprisingly even cut. In many religions (Western Christianity, Ancient Egyptian religion, and others) priests and/or monks cut/shave their hair. Roman Catholic nuns also tend to cut and mantain their hair short under their veils when they enter the nunneries. The cutting of one`s own hair is also a part of Buddhist mythology, specifically something done by Siddhartha himself early on in his path to enlightenment, so anime examples might draw from this as an allusion. There are also some cultures, including Native American and many Asians, where a person would cut his or her hair as an act of grief, disgrace, or even rebellion. In the Confucian tradition, hair (like the rest of your body) is considered a gift from your parents and may not be damaged without a very good reason. Furthermore, prisoners and psychiatric patients commonly have their heads shaved, often to prevent the spread of lice, but sometimes also as a demeaning measure. Source: TVTRope

tag.name: occupation and career
tag.description: The kind of anime which shows the career of a character, usually from the beginning.

tag.name: underdog
tag.description: The character portrayed in this anime is seemingly not cut for his challenge. He is expected to be no match for his rivals or enemies. However, mostly through hard work and dedication he will eventually overcome his limitations.

tag.name: strong male lead
tag.description: The lead male protagonist in this anime shows backbone, is competent, and does not shy away from seemingly insurmountable objectives.

tag.name: Bright slap
tag.description: "You hit me! Not even my father ever hit me!" You are the commander of a spaceship, leader of a faction or a team and your best mecha pilot stops fighting and grows increasingly hysterical and angsty, while the enemy could strike you at any time. What are you going to do? You slap or punch him, preferably in the face, and back to his senses while delivering a heroic speech that would turn any wimp into a man of destiny. Named after Bright Noa of Mobile Suit Gundam, a prominent user of this for-sure method.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: serious business
tag.description: For some people it is just a card- or board game. For others it is not just a matter of life and death — it is much more important than that. Serious business basically describes a situation, when a show revolves around an activity where a sizeable portion of the in-series population takes it far more seriously than it should. If something`s popularity rivals that of Elvis, or if there are mainstream schools devoted to it instead of teaching reading, writing, and arithmetic; it is serious business.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

character.name: Mitsuyoshi Anzai
character.description: The coach of the Shohoku High basketball team, and one of the best ones in Japan. Even the coaches of other teams call him "Anzai-sensei" with respect. His calm and collected attitude contrasts with the temper he had in the past, when he was nicknameed "White-Haired Devil" as a demanding college coach.

character.name: Sakuragi Hanamichi
character.description: Hanamichi Sakuragi is the protagonist of Slam Dunk. At the beginning of the series, Sakuragi was a slacker, good for nothing other than fighting (he was on the brink of getting identified by those around him as a delinquent). He is the leader of the feared "Sakuragi Legion", which consists of his four friends Mito, Noma, Ohkusu and Takamiya. Sakuragi`s quest for love was nothing but humiliating. He was always trying to ask girls out, but was rejected constantly, the 50th rejection occurring at the start of the series. He then met Haruko Akagi, a lovely basketball fangirl, whom he fell in love with immediately. This and Haruko`s encouragement led to him to join the Shohoku basketball team.

character.name: Rukawa Kaede
character.description: Rukawa Kaede is Sakuragi`s rival as well as almost his opposite; he is attractive to girls, skilled at basketball, and very cold and unfeeling. The only traits they share are that they are not academically inclined and good fighters. He regards Sakuragi as an idiot and both normally fight. Actually, he knows Sakuragi can put his talents to a better use, but is ashamed to see the immaturity with which he deals with things. His hobby is sleeping, and is usually seen asleep whenever he`s not on the court; he can even ride his bike while asleep often crashing with objects when doing so. Waking Rukawa from a nap is considered unforgivable, since he will almost automatically beat up the culprit. Unsurprisingly, he has also been in his fair share of off-court fights, but can hold his own. Rukawa`s goal is to be the best high school player in Japan, and he considers Sendou of Ryonan to be his greatest rival. A fact being that he is often nicknamed the "super-rookie", the "ace of Shohoku", even.

character.name: Akagi Takenori
character.description: Akagi Takenori is the captain of the Shohoku basketball team and Haruko`s older brother. Despite at first not thinking too much of Sakuragi (who addresses him as "Gori" for gorilla due to his immense physical presence), he actually realizes Sakuragi`s potential as a basketball player. Serious and disciplined, Akagi`s dream is to lead Shohoku to the national championship. His determination is shown in the match against Kainan, where he played on despite a serious injury to his ankle. Akagi considers Uozumi of Ryonan to be his biggest rival, though their rivalry is not antagonistic; indeed, there is respect that borders on friendship.

character.name: Miyagi Ryouta
character.description: Miyagi Ryouta is Sakuragi`s closest friend on the team, making him the only person apart from Akagi whose advice Sakuragi will actually heed both on and off the basketball court. After an initial misunderstanding that caused conflict between them (he was fighting Mitsui when Sakuragi and Ayako came around, and he thought she was dating him), both found comradeship in the fact that they had both been unlucky in love, although Miyagi, having only been rejected 10 times, still falls short of Sakuragi`s record of 50 rejections. Like Sakuragi, Miyagi is motivated to play by his love for a girl: his best friend and classmate Ayako, the manager of the team, whom he refers to as "Aya-chan". He has been known to pose for Ayako during matches. Off-court, Miyagi has a reputation for being a bad boy. He was hospitalized for a while after his fight against Mitsui`s gang.

character.name: Mitsui Hisashi
character.description: Hisashi Mitsui was an MVP for Takeishi Junior High. Despite having opportunities to join more prestigious high schools like Ryonan, he choose to go to Shohoku because of Coach Anzai; Anzai had given him the courage to win in the Junior High tournament by encouraging him during the last seconds of the match. However, an injury to his left knee in a training session interrupted his basketball career. An imprudent early return to the basketball court reinjured the knee more severely, leading to a basketball hiatus of over a year. Although he eventually healed, he was embittered by his exclusion from the court, and quit basketball to become the leader of a gang. His gang picked on Miyagi during his first year, and during a fight that ensued Miyagi beat Mitsui senseless before taking a beating himself. Afterwards, Mitsui attempted to ruin the basketball team by instigating them into fighting with his gang, as the team would have been banned from competition for fighting. In the end, Sakuragi`s own gang - Youhei, Takamiya, Ookusu and Noma - voluntarily took the blame for the fight, and Mitsui was filled with remorse when he saw Anzai again. He rejoined the team and vowed never to fight again.

character.name: Kogure Kiminobu
character.description: Kogure Kiminobu is Shohoku`s vice-captain and a good friend to Akagi and Mitsui. He and Akagi are the only two players who have been on the team for all three years - Mitsui left during their first year, while other players quit the team because they found Akagi`s training regimen to be too strenuous. Along with Miyagi and Ayako, he always tries to bring out the most of Hanamichi`s talent. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Sendou Akira
character.description: Akira Sendoh is Ryonan`s ace and is considered one of the top players in Kanagawa. An easygoing person, Sendoh usually has a smile on his face whether on-court or off. He can be lazy at times, and has a reputation for arriving late to practice sessions and matches. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Uozumi Jun
character.description: Uozomi Jun is Ryonan`s captain. He considers Takenori Akagi his rival, but has never managed to personally beat him, although Akagi considers him to be better. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Jin Souichirou
character.description: Jin Soichiro is one of the best sharpshooters in Kanagawa, matched only by Mitsui. He originally used to be a center, but his slender build, slow movement and weak leaping ability never allowed him to perform well in this position. Instead of being discouraged, he became a shooting guard, where he could put his talents to better use. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kiyota Nobunaga
character.description: Kiyota Nobunaga is always bragging about how he is the real star rookie of Kanagawa, instead of Rukawa. However, he tends to underestimate other teams, especially Shohoku, and this can lead to embarrassing situations, such as when Akagi flattened him with a dunk. Kiyota likes to call Hanamichi "Red-furred Monkey" while Hanamichi calls him "Wild Monkey". Source: wikipedia

character.name: Maki Shinichi
character.description: Maki Shin`ichi is reputed to be the best player in Kanagawa, and was crowned prefectural MVP twice. As team captain, he exerts great leadership over his teammates, who follow his orders to the letter. Though his personality belies it, he can be as strict as Akagi, but mostly only towards Kiyota. He is commonly noted to be very old to be in high schools; Maki responds by pointing out that Akagi looks even older. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Miyamasu Yoshinori
character.description: Miyamasu Yoshinori is known as the sixth man for Kainan. His unimposing presence (by comparison, he is 5 cm shorter and 10 kg lighter than Hikoichi Aida) distracts opponents from his real basketball skills, especially his reliable 3 point shooting, the accuracy of which is comparable to Jin`s and Mitsui`s 3 point shooting. Though he has to wear glasses, when called to play, he replaces them with a pair of goggles. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Takato Riki
character.description: Takato Riki is Kainan`s coach and a contemporary of Ryonan`s Moichi Taoka, who is a year older than him. Both of them have known each other since high school, when Takato was known as the "Rookie from Hell" in his first year. He has been responsible in some degree for the team`s domination of the Kanagawa Interhigh Tournament for the past 17 years. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Aida Hikoichi
character.description: Aida Hikoichi aspires to become a player like his Ryonan teammates but, not being up to their level, he just stays with the reserves (more specifically with the coach, Moichi Taoka) and acts more as a team manager than a full player, taking detailed notes during matches. His catchphrase is "gotta check it," aside from shouting "Unbelievable!!!" every time something exciting happens during a match. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Fukuda Kicchou
character.description: Fukuda Kicchou is the other ace Ryonan has up their sleeve. His offensive power rivals many of the best players in the Kanagawa prefecture and is seen throughout the series doing alley oops with Sendoh as the passer but his defensive ability is weak and can be easily exploited. He has something of a special rivalry going on with Hanamichi from the first time they knew of each other, when the latter was depressed over the loss to Kainan and was near a basketball court where Fukuda was practicing. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Taoka Moichi
character.description: Taoka Moichi is Ryonan`s coach and a contemporary of Kainan`s Takato Riki, who is a year younger than him. Both of them have known each other since high school, when Taoka was known as "Kanagawa`s Taoka". Taoka compares himself to Sendoh, which his players find hard to believe. Both men are still friends, but are also rivals. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Fukatsu Kazunari
character.description: Fukatsu Kazunari is the captain of this multi-talented champion team. He is able to read and control the flow of the game quite well. He always plays with a calm and cool demeanor, looking to exploit any flaws in the opposing team. He possesses great passing skills, an accurate three point shot, and excellent defensive powers. He forms the core trio of the Sannoh team, along with Masashi and Sawakita. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Yasuda Yasuharu
character.description: Yasuda Yasuharu is one of the minor players from Shohoku. Although Hanamichi picks on him, he is no pushover, as demonstrated when he stood up to Mitsui and Tetsuo when they were attempting to get the Shohoku team banned from competition for fighting. He is Ryota`s close friend, and thanks to his mild and calm character he can manage to calm things down when the tension on the court starts to heat up. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Fujima Kenji
character.description: Fujima Kenji is the player and coach of Shoyo High. As such, he only enters the court when his presence is really needed, such as when the team is behind and struggling. Fujima is so respected by his teammates that as much as possible they try not to make it necessary for him to get on the court, and even the hint of his getting off the bench to join them inspires them to play harder. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Hanagata Touru
character.description: Hanagata Touru is considered one of the top centers in the Kanagawa prefecture along with Akagi and Uozumi. He mixes strength and tactical skill in his playing, being able to easily avoid defensive play. When Fujima is not on court, he takes the role of captain, being responsible for psyching up the team. For this, he is quite a trustworthy player for Shoyo. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Hasegawa Kazushi
character.description: Hasegawa Kazushi has a personal history with Mitsui. Back in junior high school, he faced Mitsui`s confidence as well as his own inability to beat him in a match. Later on in high school, he encountered Mitsui again after the latter had become a delinquent and was shocked to see how much he had changed. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Sakuragi Gundan
character.description: Sakuragi`s Gang, also known as The Sakuragi Legion, act like a Greek chorus. Consists of Mito Youhei, Noma Chuuichirou, Ookusu Yuuji and Takamiya Nozomi.

character.name: Mito Youhei
character.description: Mito Youhei is Sakuragi`s best friend from childhood as well as a skilled fighter. although Yohei is the only one able to help with actual advice. He also appears to be the best fighter out of the four aside from Sakuragi himself, having beat Mitsui badly all on his own during the gym fight. Source: wikipedia

character.name: Noma Chuuichirou
character.description: Sakuragi`s Gang member.

character.name: Ookusu Yuuji
character.description: Sakuragi`s Gang member.

character.name: Takamiya Nozomi
character.description: Sakuragi`s Gang member.

character.name: Aota Tatsuhiko
character.description: Aota Tatsuhiko is the captain of the Shohoku judo team. He is a childhood friend of the Akagi siblings, having argued with http://anidb.net/ch8316 [Takenori] over which sport was better, judo or basketball, since their youth. This grudge continued until their present age, where their feud is over which team will be National Champion first. He once tried to make http://anidb.net/ch7225 [Sakuragi] join the judo team because he considered his fighting skills exceptional, and to achieve this, "bribed" him with some photos of http://anidb.net/ch15411 [Haruko] when she was younger. Still, Sakuragi refused, saying simply, "because I`m a basketball player" (actually because he knew he would actually be closer to Haruko if he stayed with the basketball team). But Tatsuhiko does not give up on trying once in a while. He is rather loyal to Takenori when the need arises, cheering him on when he is outplayed and hard-pressed during the second Ryonan match. Despite his inability to physically coerce Sakuragi into joining the judo team, Tatsuhiko has proven that he is skilled, as he is the sole member of the judo team to qualify for the National Championships in judo. It is also worth noting that Tatsuhiko has had a crush on Haruko since they were young. She calls him "Ta-chan" instead of by his last name, which irritates Sakuragi immensely.

character.name: Fujii
character.description: Fujii is http://anidb.net/ch15411 [Haruko]`s friend.

character.name: Matsui
character.description: Matsui is Haruko`s friend.

character.name: Koike
character.description: Koike is a Mathematics teacher and wears the thick glasses. The enemy`s eyes to the bad attitude Sakuragi and Rukawa class has a hard time against them.

episode.title: 天才バスケットマン誕生!?
Birth of a Basketball Genius!?
La naissance d`un génie du basket
กำเนิดนักบาสอัจฉริยะ!?
Tensai Basketman Tanjou!?
episode.summary: Hanamichi Sakuragi, an entering Shohoku high school freshman holds a record for being rejected by 50 girls during middle school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道デビュー! ダンクさく裂
Hanamichi`s Debut: A Burst of Dunks
Les débuts de Hanamichi. Ça va dunker
ฮานามิจิแจ้งเกิด! เปิดตัวด้วยดั๊งค์อันรุนแรง
Hanamichi Debut! Dunk Sakuretsu
episode.summary: The pick-up game match between the freshmen and upperclassmen continues to heat up. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリラvs花道! 究極の対決!!
Gorilla vs. Hanamichi: The Ultimate Match
Gorille vs Hanamichi. Le combat ultime
กอริลล่า ปะทะ ฮานามิจิ! การต่อสู้อันน่าระทึก!!
Gorilla vs Hanamichi! Kyuukyoku no Taiketsu!!
episode.summary: Gori and Hanamichi`s confrontation continues, and the condition for the 1 on 1 game is set. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道ピンチ! 柔道男の罠
Hanamichi in a Bind! The Judo Man`s Trap!
Attention à toi Hanamichi. Le piège du judoka
ฮานามิจิติดกับดัก! ของชมรมยูโด
Hanamichi Pinch! Juudou-otoko no Wana
episode.summary: One rainy day Akagi learns from the captain of the Judo club, Aota, that the Judo club is plotting to recruit Hanamichi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バスケットマン花道入部!
Basketball Athlete Hanamichi Makes the Team
Hanamichi le basketteur s`inscrit au club
ฮานามิจิเข้าชมรมบาสเก็ตบอล
Basketman Hanamichi Nyuubu!
episode.summary: Riding high on his victory over Akagi, Hanamichi breaks into the team locker room and wears Akagi`s uniform. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オレはバスケットをやる!
I`m Sticking with Basketball!
Ore wa Basket o Yaru!
episode.summary: At the judo dojo, Hanamichi meets with Aota and is enticed into joining the judo club after being offered a photograph of Haruko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 根性なしの午後
A Spiritles Afternoon
Un après-midi sans volonté
ในบ่ายวันหนึ่งที่ความอดทนหมดลง
Konjounashi no Gogo
episode.summary: Though one week has passed since the rookie, Hanamichi, is accepted into the team, he finds himself practicing dribbling in the corner of the court. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 流川vs赤木・本物対決!
Rukawa vs. Akagi: Battle Between the Real Deals
Akagi vs Rukawa. Le combat des titans
รุคาว่า กับอาคางิ ดวลกันตัวต่อตัว
Rukawa vs Akagi: Honmono Taiketsu!
episode.summary: Hanamichi absorbs the lessons like a sponge and continues to become a respectable member of the basketball team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 庶民のシュートはむずかしい
The Simple Shot Is Tricky
Shomin no Shoot wa Muzukashii
episode.summary: Hanamichi feels himself increasingly attracted to basketball, and he begins to take the sport more seriously. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: くたばれバスケ! 花道vs流川
Go to Hell, Basketball! Hanamichi vs. Rukawa
À mort le basket. Akagi vs Hanamichi
คู่แข่งคนสำคัญ! ฮานามิจิ ปะทะ รุคาว่า
Kutabare Baske! Hanamichi vs Rukawa
episode.summary: Rukawa, the object of Haruko`s affection, runs into Hanamichi on the school roof. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タイムアップ! 決着陵南戦
Time`s Up! Final Showdown with Ryonan
Time Up! Kecchaku Ryounansen
episode.summary: In deperation to hold off the raging Ryonan, Shohoku uses Hanamichi and Rukawa to double team on Sendo. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才花道! 必殺ダンク
Genius Hanamichi! Killer Dunk
Tensai Hanamichi! Hissatsu Dunk
episode.summary: Naito succeeds in taunting Hanamichi to get into foul trouble. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道キンチョーの晴れ舞台!
Hanamichi`s Nerve-wracking Big Moment
Hanamichi Kinchou no Harebutai!
episode.summary: The first half of the game ends with a score of 50 to 42 and Ryonan continues to overwhelm Shohoku. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人だけの愛の秘密特訓!?
Secret Special Training for Love
Futari dake no Ai no Himitsu Tokkun!?
episode.summary: During an early morning special training session, Hanamichi earnestly listens to Haruko`s lessons. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三井寿15歳の悩み
The Angst of 15 Year Old Hisashi Mitsui
Mitsui Hisashi 15-sai no Nayami
episode.summary: After Kogure`s confession, Hanamichi and the others learn of Mitsui`s glorious past as a star basketball player entering high school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 史上最悪どあほうコンビ誕生
The Birth of the Ultimate Idiot Combination
Shijou Saiaku Doahou Combi Tanjou
episode.summary: The battle between Hanamichi and Ryota continues...although Hanamichi starts it by playing dirty, and the fight is nothing more than a childish fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道・初スタメン!
Hanamichi: Starting for the First Time!
Hanamichi: Hatsu StaMem!
episode.summary: Shohoku`s next opponent is Shoyo High School. The team`s captain, Fujima, also serves as coach. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 退場王!? 桜木花道
The Foul-Out King!? Hanamichi Sakuragi
Taijou Ou!? Sakuragi Hanamichi
episode.summary: Shohoku is victorious in their first match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なんだコイツは!? 田岡の誤算
Who the Hell Is He? Taoka`s Big Mistake!
Nanda Koitsu wa!? Taoka no Gosan
episode.summary: Hanamichi enters the game with 9 minutes left in the 2nd half. With the loss of Akagi, Coach Taoka believes the game is over. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 倒せ陵南! 決戦前夜の猛特訓
Beat Ryonan! Training the Night Before the Game!
Taose Ryounan! Kessen Zen`ya no Moutokkun
episode.summary: A person appears in the gym where Hanamichi is practicing alone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バスケがしたいです!
I Want to Play Basketball!
Baske ga Shitai Desu!
episode.summary: Mitsui`s downfall... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 湘北バスケ部最後の日
The Last Day for the Shohoku Basketball Team
Shouhoku Baske-bu Saigo no Hi
episode.summary: As Hanamichi and Ryota become friends, Mitsui brings the thug, Tetsuo, to the gym during practice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 流川の反撃!
Rukawa`s Counterattack!
Rukawa no Hangeki!
episode.summary: Shohoku realizes Shoyo`s strength. The senior Hanagata, whose glasses are his trademark, shoots a fade away jump shot and shows off his skills. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリ直伝・眼で殺せ!
Gorilla Transmitted: Kill with a Look!
Gori Jikiden: Me de Korose!
episode.summary: After fouling out two games in a row, Hanamichi`s distress has reached its peak. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リバウンド王 桜木花道の苦悩
Rebound King Hanamichi Sakuragi`s Distress!
Rebound Ou: Sakuragi Hanamichi no Kunou
episode.summary: Rukawa, who dominated in rebounds, brings Shohoku up to 70 to 67. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハンセイ軍団の大反撃
The Repentent Gang`s Huge Counterattack
Hansei Gundan no Daihangeki
episode.summary: As Miuradai leads 22 to 8, Shohoku finally sends its best players out to court. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 湘北vs陵南 燃える主将[キャプテン]!
Shohoku vs. Ryonan! The Fiery Captains!
Shouhoku vs Ryounan: Moeru Captain!
episode.summary: Sparks quickly begin to fly between Akagi and Uozumi - the showdown has already begun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: インターハイ予選開始
The Interscholastic Prelims Begin
Inter High Yosen Kaishi
episode.summary: Mitsui, who changes his ways, rejoins the basketball team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正義の味方・桜木軍団参上!
Heroes of Justice: The Arrival of Sakuragi`s Gang!
Seigi no Mikata: Sakuragi Gundan Sanjou!
episode.summary: Rukawa can no longer put up with Mitsui who is doing whatever he pleases. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 電光石火のリョータ!
Ryota Quick as Lightning
Denkousekka no Ryouta!
episode.summary: Rukawa`s mentions that "everyone`s movements are stiff," and it causes the team to regain their pace, and the team plays harder. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バスケットシューズ
Basketball Shoes
Basket Shoes
episode.summary: Hanamichi is still shocked after their loss to Ryonan but gains encouragement through Haruko`s words. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男たちの熱き想い
The Heated Sentiment of Men
Otoko-tachi no Atsuki Omoi
episode.summary: On the day of the third game, the team is annoyed that Hanamichi and Mitsui have not yet arrived. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラスト2分! 仙道は俺が倒す
Two Minutes Left! I`ll Take Sendo Down
Last 2-fun! Sendou wa Ore ga Taosu
episode.summary: With Akagi`s return, Rukawa resting on the bench, and Hanamichi remembering the fundamentals of rebounds. Shohoku regains momentum. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強敵三浦台の秘密兵器
The Secret Weapon of the Formidable Miuradai
Kyouteki Miuradai no Himitsu Heiki
episode.summary: Rukawa`s play helps Shohoku tie the game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超高校級! 陵南ドトウの攻撃
Ultimate High School Level! Ryonan`s Aggressive Attack!!
Choukoukoukyuu! Ryounan Dotou no Kougeki
episode.summary: The match begins and Shouhoku quickly lets the other opponent score. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道! 公式戦デビュー
Hanamichi! Official Game Debut
Hanamichi! Koushikisen Debut
episode.summary: At the game against Miuradai, the key players--Hanamichi, Rukawa, Ryota, and Mitsu--are left on the bench. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全国制覇をめざした男
The Man Who Aimed for the National Championship
Zenkoku Seiha o Mezashita Otoko
episode.summary: Youhei and Sakuragi`s Gang come to the rescue to defeat Mitsui and his gang. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スーパー問題児! 花道VS宮城
Super Problem Children! Hanamichi vs. Miyagi
Super Mondaiji! Hanamichi vs. Miyagi
episode.summary: The guy who Ohkusu and Youhei glare at is a second year guard of the basketball team, Ryota Miyagi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シード校・翔陽登場
A Seeded School: Enter Shoyo
Seed Kou: Shouyou Toujou
episode.summary: Hanamichi fouls out yet again for the third straight game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 武園・最後の闘志
Takezono
Takezono: Saigo no Toushi
episode.summary: A game where everyone expects Kainan Auxiliary High to win, the game against Takezono High begins with Oda in the starting lineup. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ライバルからの挑戦状
A Challenge from a Rival
Rival kara no Chousenjou
episode.summary: The day after the game against Shoyo, Hanamichi reminisces about his first ever slam dunk. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: がけっぷちの湘北
Shohoku on the Edge
Gakeppuchi no Shouhoku
episode.summary: The night after the shocking loss, Akagi and the team recoveres. Ayako writes "On the Edge," and the team instill it in their mind that they can`t lose anymore. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 退場目前!? 花道ピンチ
Impending Foul-Out!?
Taijou Mokuzen!? Hanamichi Pinch
episode.summary: Thanks to Mitsui`s willed plays, Shohoku`s deficit goes down to 3 points. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三井, 限界か!?
Mitsui, at His Limit!?
Mitsui, Genkai ka!?
episode.summary: Mitsui, who has been covered by Hasegawa`s tough defense, reaches his limits and he seems to be standing only on pure willpower. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: しぶとい奴ら!
Die-Hard Dudes!
Shibutoi Yatsura!
episode.summary: Down by four in the last four minutes and thirty seconds, Shohoku resorts to an all-out effort. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 翔陽エース・藤真登場
The Appearance of Shoyo Star, Fujima
Shouyou Ace: Fujima Toujou
episode.summary: Shohoku escapes a bad situation with the help of Hanamichi dominating in rebounds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エース牧・全開!
Superstar Maki at Full Throttle
Ace Maki: Zenkai!
episode.summary: With Rukawa`s performance, Shohoku ties the game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キングコング・弟
The Younger Brother of King Kong
King Kong: Otouto
episode.summary: Hanamichi is ready to fill the void as Akagi leaves the game with a foot injury. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 桜木封じの秘密兵器!
The Secret Weapon
Sakuragi Fuuji no Himitsuheiki!
episode.summary: In the last 10 minutes of the first half, Kainan leads 24 to 20, and inserts a third year, Miyamasu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王者への挑戦
A Challenge to the Champions
Ouja e no Chousen
episode.summary: The final four is Shohoku, Kainan, Ryonan, and Takezato. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 打倒海南を誓う男
The Man Who Vows to Crush Kainan
Datou Kainan o Chikau Otoko
episode.summary: Hanamichi`s 50th rejection was by Yoko. Yoko`s man of interest is Hanamichi`s rival, Oda in Takezono High. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボーズ頭の逆襲!
The Revenge of the Baldhead!
Bouzuatama no Gyakushuu!
episode.summary: To make a clean start, Hanamichi shaves his head but is unhappy with the spectators he attracts. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道, 熱きダンク
Hanamichi, a Fiery Dunk
Hanamichi, Atsuki Dunk
episode.summary: With two minutes and thirty seconds left in the second half, the score is tied 60 to 60. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三井! 嵐の3ポイント
Mitsui! Thunderous Three-Pointers
Mitsui! Arashi no 3 Point
episode.summary: Hasegawa had watched Mitsui play in junior high and practiced hard to exceed Mitsui. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラスト10秒! 完全決着
The Last 10 Seconds! The Final Score
Last 10-byou! Kanzen Kecchaku
episode.summary: In the final 46 seconds, Kainan leads 90 to 86. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 翔陽エース藤真の実力
The True Power of Shoyo Star, Fujima
Shouyou Ace Fujima no Jitsuryoku
episode.summary: Fujima`s play on the court amazes everyone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 安西・勝利への賭け!
Anzai`s Gamble to Win!
Anzai: Shouri e no Kake!
episode.summary: With 10 minutes left in the second half, Shohoku was down 73 to 63 as Coach Anzai calls a timeout. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リバウンド王・桜木花道
Rebound King: Hanamichi Sakuragi
Rebound Ou: Sakuragi Hanamichi
episode.summary: Shohoku gain on Shoyo with the help of Ryota`s plays. Along with Mitsui`s 3 point shots, the game is tied 11 to 11. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲームを支配する男
The Man Who Controls the Game
Game o Shihai Suru Otoko
episode.summary: With one minute and thirty seconds left in the first half, Kainan leads 45 to 40. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリ負傷! 絶体絶命!?
Gorilla`s Injury! A Desperate Situation!?
Gori Fushou! Zettaizetsumei!?
episode.summary: Shohoku is down by 15 in the first half. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 計算外!? 花道絶好調!
Miscalculation!?
Keisangai!? Hanamichi Zekkouchou!
episode.summary: Preparing for the Nationals, Kainan Auxiliary High and Shohoku High start their first game of the district finals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 日本一の高校生
Japan`s Number One High School Player
Nippon`ichi no Koukousei
episode.summary: Hanamichi who bumps into Maki and Nobunaga of Kainan decides to follow them to Nagoya to check out the "Star of Aichi". Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 特訓3DAYS
3 Days of Special Training
Tokkun 3 Days
episode.summary: After losing the Kainan game, only two games remain: Takezato and Ryonan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ファインプレイ
Great Play
Fine Play
episode.summary: In the second half, Rukawa continues to play perfectly against Sendo in a back-and-forth game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 流川・後半戦への賭け
Rukawa, Bet on the Second Half
Rukawa: Kouhansen e no Kake
episode.summary: Second half. Sendo has realized that Rukawa is not playing as aggressive as usual. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリ・復活の雄叫び!
Gorilla`s Comeback Roar!
Gori: Fukkatsu no Otakebi!
episode.summary: Being thrown down by Uozumi, Hanamichi doesn`t move. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリ異変!
Gorilla Abnormal!
Gori Ihen!
episode.summary: The Ryonan game continues with the score tied two to two. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最終決戦! 湘北VS陵南
Final Battle! Shohoku vs. Ryonan
Saishuu Kessen! Shouhoku vs. Ryounan
episode.summary: The day of the Ryonan game finally comes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強対決! 仙道vs牧
The Biggest Showdown! Sendo vs. Maki
Saikyou Taiketsu! Sendou vs. Maki
episode.summary: Uozumi objects to the referee`s call and picks up a technical. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 頂上決戦! 海南VS陵南
Battle for the Summit! Kainan vs. Ryonan
Choujou Kessen! Kainan vs. Ryounan
episode.summary: The Ryonan and Kainan game starts. In this game, Ryonan inserts Kicchou Fukuda, who was not at the practice game against Shohoku. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利の予感
Victory Premonition
Shouri no Yokan
episode.summary: Last ten minutes of the second half. Hanamichi who took out Uozumi shows off his ability. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最も危険な挑戦者
The Most Dangerous Challenger
Mottomo Kiken na Chousensha
episode.summary: Rukawa who was saving his energy in the first half explodes in the second half. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人生最大の屈辱
Worst Insult Ever
Jinsei Saidai no Kutsujoku
episode.summary: Eyeing Hanamichi`s weak defense, Ryonan throws the ball to Fukuda who is guarded by Hanamichi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴリラダンクII
Gorilla Dunk II
Gorilla Dunk II
episode.summary: After the collision, Akagi`s performance is compromised due to his concern for his foot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 救世主!? 桜木花道
Savior!? Hanamichi Sakuragi
Kyuuseishu!? Sakuragi Hanamichi
episode.summary: Ryonan scores first, but Shohoku`s Hanamichi scores right back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 仙道・一瞬の賭け!
Sendo: A Split Second Gamble!
Sendou: Isshun no Kake!
episode.summary: Akagi and the team learn that Hanamichi`s quick action saved Coach Anzai`s life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本領発揮! 王者・海南
Full Throttle! Kainan the Champions
Honryou Hakki! Ouja: Kainan
episode.summary: With Sendo`s performance, Ryonan leads 29 to 39 into the second half. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: BW[ブルーウェーブ]! 陵南の反撃
Blue Wave! Ryonan`s Counterattack
Blue Wave! Ryounan no Hangeki
episode.summary: With Uozumi`s intense focus, Shohoku`s one-sided game gradually changes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男の友情!? 桜木軍団
Male Friendship!? Sakuragi`s Gang
Otoko no Yuujou!? Sakuragi Gundan
episode.summary: To be able to cheer Hanamichi on at the game, Yohei and his friends get part-time jobs to pay for travel expenses to Hiroshima. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 君たちは強い
All of You Are Strong
Kimitachi wa Tsuyoi
episode.summary: Less than nine minutes left, Shohoku leads 53 to 46. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 湘北真のエース!
Shohoku`s True Star!
Shouhoku Shin no Ace!
episode.summary: The intensity in Rukawa and Mitsui`s one-on-one is increasing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バスケットの国アメリカ
A Land of Basketball
Basket no Kuni America
episode.summary: Kogure felt malaise from Rukawa, which is due to Rukawa`s wanting to go to America. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 流川の野望
Rukawa`s Ambition
Rukawa no Yabou
episode.summary: Hikoichi`s big sister and reporter, Yayoi Aida`s report on Sendo is nixed by the chief editor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝敗
Victory or Defeat
Shouhai
episode.summary: With less than a minute, Kogure`s three-pointer gives Shohoku a four-point lead with the score 68 to 64. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 湘北危うし! 脅威の最強軍団
Shohoku in Trouble!
Shouhoku Ayaushi! Kyoui no Saikyou Gundan
episode.summary: When Sendo joins the mixed team, they establishes chemistry, making crisp passes, and continuous dramatic combinations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ド素人・花道本領発揮
Super Amateur, Hanamichi in His Element
Doshirouto: Hanamichi Honryou Hakki
episode.summary: In the last two minutes and 18 seconds, Shohoku has a two point lead. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡の男・桜木花道!
Man of Miracles, Hanamichi Sakuragi!
Kiseki no Otoko: Sakuragi Hanamichi!
episode.summary: Shohoku`s scrimmage with the mixed team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱き思い・魚住再び!
The Passionate Heart, Uozumi Once Again!
Atsuki Omoi: Uozumi Futatabi!
episode.summary: Hanamichi annoyingly suggests a practice game to show off the results of his special training to Akagi and the rest of the team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 湘北の不安要素
Shohoku`s Negative Attributes
Shouhoku no Fuan Youso
episode.summary: Shohoku is wielded by Ryonan`s pressure. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花道の最も熱き一日
Hanamichi`s Hottest Day of His Life
Hanamichi no Mottomo Atsuki Ichinichi
episode.summary: While Hanamichi works hard on his 20,000 jumps jump shot training, Haruko invites him to the festival for a change of pace. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 2万本への挑戦
A 20,000 Shot Challenge
2-manbon e no Chousen
episode.summary: Finally, the intense training camp has started. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活! 闘将・魚住純
Revival! Fired Up Captain, Jun Uozumi
Fukkatsu! Toushou: Uozumi Jun
episode.summary: Ryonan is on the brink of losing. Sendo`s exhaustion has peaked and they are in a desperate situation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全国が危ない!
The Nationals at Risk
Zenkoku ga Abunai!
episode.summary: The Shohoku basketball team encounters an unexpected crisis. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼気迫る! 流川
Unstoppable Intensity! Rukawa
Kikisemaru! Rukawa
episode.summary: All the schools who are entering the Nationals have been decided. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あらたなる挑戦! 全国制覇
A New Challenge
Aratanaru Chousen! Zenkoku Seiha
episode.summary: Whole Shohoku High School is making some noise after the basketball team`s achievements of run-ups in the district tournament and entry to the Nationals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 副主将[キャプテン]メガネ君の執念
Assistant Captain Four Eyes` Tenacity
Fuku Captain Megane-kun no Shuunen
episode.summary: With Hanamichi`s performance, the momentum changes again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 栄光のスラムダンク
Glorious Slam Dunk
Eikou no Slam Dunk
episode.summary: The opportunity has finally presented itself for Hanamichi to show off his new move, the "Training Camp Shot". Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激闘開始! 湘北vs翔陽・陵南
Intense Battle Begins!
Gekitou Kaishi! Shouhoku vs. Shouyou-Ryounan
episode.summary: The Shoyo and Ryonan mixed team consists of Fujima, Hanagata, and Hasegawa from Shoyo along with Uozumi and Ikegami from Ryonan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 仙道ファイヤー! 湘北崩壊!!
Sendo on Fire! Shohoku`s Collapse!!
Sendou Fire! Shouhoku Houkai!!
episode.summary: In the last three minutes and 18 seconds, with Sendo reverting back to his old self as "Scoring Machine", Ryonan catches up to make it 58 to 65. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バスケットシューズII
Basketball Shoes II
Basket Shoes II
episode.summary: The final day of training camp. Hanamichi finally makes his final jump shot to end his 20,000 jump shot training. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 静岡の激闘! 湘北vs常誠
Fierce Battle at Shizuoka!
Shizuoka no Gekitou! Shouhoku vs. Jousei
episode.summary: While Hanamichi is practicing his 20,000 jump shots, Akagi and the team have a practice game in Shizuoka. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激闘2連戦! 湘北対武里&陵南対海南! ニュー花道・炎の猛特訓!
2 Fierce Battles! Shohoku vs Takezato & Ryonan vs Kainan! New Hanamichi - Special Burning Training!
Gekitou 2-rensen! Shouhoku Tai Takezato & Ryounan Tai Kainan! New Hanamichi Honoo no Moutokkun!
